channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Syrian Rebel Groups Launch Largest Offensive in Years
item.description: Scores of people were killed after forces opposed to the government of President Bashar al-Assad overtook a Syrian military base, a monitoring group r...

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck crash leaves 3 dead and 1 seriously injured in California
item.description: Piedmont Police Chief Jeremy Bowers said speed was likely a factor in the single-vehicle collision.

item.title: U.S. preps China chip curbs that stop short of early proposals
item.description: U.S. chip gear makers argue that unilateral U.S. restrictions would put them at an unfair disadvantage compared to foreign rivals.

item.title: Middle East Crisis Updates: Lebanon Sends Troops to Support Cease-Fire as Thousands of Civilians Head South
item.description: The Lebanese Army said it was deploying forces near the Israeli border as a U.S.-backed truce between Israel and Hezbollah militants began to take eff...

item.title: Syrian Rebel Groups Launch Largest Offensive in Years
item.description: Scores of people were killed after forces opposed to the government of President Bashar al-Assad overtook a Syrian military base, a monitoring group r...

item.title: Microsoft faces broad antitrust investigation from U.S. FTC
item.description: After more than a year of conducting informal interviews with competitors and business partners, antitrust enforcers have crafted a detailed request t...

item.title: As Plastic Talks Continue, a Reminder of What We’re All Exposed To
item.description: As international talks continue this week, a dozen U.N. officials reveal scientists tracked their exposure to many chemicals found in plastics.

item.title: CEOs are warning Trump tariffs will hit consumers: ‘Higher prices are not helpful’
item.description: Donald Trump’s tariffs will likely crunch supply chains and deal out hurdles to shoppers.

item.title: The Sidewalk Fruit Vendor Who Sold a $6.2 Million Banana for 25 Cents
item.description: A 74-year-old immigrant who works outside Sotheby’s shares a basement in the Bronx and works 12-hour shifts. He was stunned to hear what his banana we...

item.title: Meet Wolfgang Streeck, the Maverick German Thinker Explaining Our World
item.description: He has a convincing theory of what has gone wrong with globalization.

item.title: How to watch the 2024 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade for free—and without cable
item.description: The turkey day tradition celebrates 98 years.

item.title: Is Communist China Coming for Your Turkey, Too?
item.description: China’s push to develop alternative proteins is not a threat to America. It’s good for the planet.

item.title: Smithfield Meat Market in London to Close
item.description: Livestock has been traded on the historic site in Britain’s capital for centuries. The local authority voted this week to close it.

item.title: 3 Americans Are Said to Be Freed From China in Prisoner Swap
item.description: The Americans were freed in exchange for a Chinese intelligence officer who was serving a 20-year sentence in the United States, officials said.

item.title: Indian Thieves See a Gold Mine in Exams for Government Jobs
item.description: In a country where government jobs are highly coveted, the tests that govern hiring are a lucrative target for criminal gangs.
